parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  The content focuses on geopolitical manipulation and political dynamics in Romania, a general topic, not tied to any specific candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual or small group. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad targeting strategy.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post touches upon political dynamics in Romania, its primary objective is not to influence the vote for any particular candidate in the parliamentary elections. The content analyzes geopolitical influences on Romanian politics, a topic that, while relevant to the political landscape, does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post appears to be an attempt at investigative journalism or citizen journalism, aiming to inform the public about geopolitical influences on Romanian politics. The link directs to an article on the website "ezs.ro," suggesting a deeper analysis of the topic. While it presents a particular perspective, it does not explicitly endorse or oppose any candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion unrelated to the electoral process. It presents an analysis of geopolitical factors influencing Romanian politics, which is a matter of public interest and falls within the realm of political commentary, not personal opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1178332110506852</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while dealing with political subject matter, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The analysis of geopolitical influences on Romanian politics, presented in the post and linked article, does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections. The post's objective appears to be informative and analytical, rather than persuasive or aimed at influencing voting behavior.  The absence of any explicit endorsement or opposition to any candidate, combined with the general nature of the content, suggests that it does not fall under the definition of electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Ez Stiri Altfel</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
